text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations - 

“Regulations of 2003” means the European Communities (Driving 
Theoretical Tests) Regulations 2003 (S.I. No. 52 of 2003); 

“theory test certificate” has the same meaning as it has in the 
Regulations of 2003.

title: conferred on him by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27
heading: 4. The Regulations of 2003 are amended by the substitution of “within the
text_raw:
4. The Regulations of 2003 are amended by the substitution of “within the 

previous 2 years and 4 months” for “within the previous 2 years” in - 

(a) 

clauses (i) and (ii) of Regulation 4(4)(f) (inserted by Regulation 
3(d) of the European Communities (Driving Theoretical Tests) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 486 of 2014), and 

(b) Column (2) of the Table to Regulation 5(4) (inserted by 
the European Communities (Driving 
Regulation 3(e) of 
Theoretical Tests) (Amendment) Regulations 2014) in both 
places where it occurs. 

1 OJ No. L 403, 30.12.2006 p. 18 
2 OJ No. L 226, 10.9.2003, p. 4 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th April, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [124] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Transport, 
Tourism and Sport, 
9 April, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport.

title: conferred on him by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Communities (Driving Theoretical 
Tests) Regulations 2003 (S.I. No. 52 of 2003) to provide that a theory test 
certificate issued during the period beginning on 1 March 2018 and ending on 
30 June 2018 is valid for a period of 2 years and 4 months from the date of 
issue. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [124] 5
